title: Smell Gas? Emergency Steps + Gas Engineer Costs 2026
excerpt: Smell gas in your home? EVACUATE NOW, call 0800 111 999 (FREE). Gas leak repair £100-£500, new boiler £1,800-£3,500. Find Gas Safe engineers.
author: TradeHub Team
metaDescription: Smell gas? Call 0800 111 999 FREE immediately. Gas leak repair £100-£500. Gas Safe engineer costs £50-£80/hr. Get West Midlands emergency help 24/7.

content.title: IMMEDIATE ACTION — GAS LEAK
steps: DO NOT turn on/off lights or electrical switches (sparks = explosion)
DO NOT use phone INSIDE house (sparks from battery can ignite gas)
Open ALL doors and windows immediately
Turn off gas at meter if safe to access (turn handle quarter-turn)
Call National Gas Emergency: 0800 111 999 (FREE, from outside or mobile away from house)
DO NOT re-enter until gas engineer says it's safe

content.text: ⚠️ DEADLY DANGER: Gas leaks cause explosions. Carbon monoxide kills silently. If you smell gas (rotten eggs), EVACUATE first, call 0800 111 999 second. Everything else can wait.

items: Smell of gas near your property

content.text: **Response time:** Emergency engineer within 1 hour (usually faster)
**Cost:** FREE — They'll make it safe, isolate leak, and advise on repairs
Gas Leak Repair Costs 2026 (After Emergency Services)

rows: Gas leak from meter/pipes OUTSIDE property
Smell gas but can't find leak

content.text: Within 1 hour, Gas Safe engineer arrives to:

items: Check for gas leaks with detection equipment
Make property safe (turn off gas supply if needed)

content.text: **This service is FREE.** They'll make it safe but won't repair your boiler/appliances.
Emergency engineer will tell you what's wrong, then you call a Gas Safe registered engineer to fix it:

rows: No hot water, boiler won't stay on
Sooty marks on boiler, CO alarm
Small leak in system, faulty valve

content.text: Is It a Gas Leak or Something Else?

items: **Rotten egg/sulfur smell** — Gas is odorless, they add this smell to warn you
**Dead plants** near gas meter outside (gas kills vegetation)

content.text: NOT a Gas Leak (But Still Check)

items: **Drains smell** — Sewage smell (different from gas, call drainage specialist)
**Burning smell** — Electrical fault (turn off electricity, call electrician)
**Smell only when boiler fires up** — May be normal (but get service if concerned)

content.text: ⚠️ When in doubt: CALL 0800 111 999. It's FREE and better safe than dead. Don't try to 'investigate' yourself.
**You CAN'T smell carbon monoxide.** It's colorless, odorless, and DEADLY.

items: See GP even if you feel better (CO stays in blood for hours)

content.text: **This saves lives.** CO alarms cost £15-£40 from B&Q/Screwfix.

items: Install near boiler, gas fire, any gas appliance

content.text: ✓ LEGAL REQUIREMENT: Landlords MUST install CO alarms in rooms with gas appliances. Homeowners: it's not legally required but you'd be insane not to have one.
When Do You Need a Gas Safe Engineer?
Emergency (Call 0800 111 999 First, Then Gas Safe Engineer)

items: Yellow/orange flame on boiler (should be blue)
No hot water or heating in winter
Gas Safety Certificate (landlords — legally required annually)
Boiler over 10 years old (service more frequently)

content.text: Gas Safe Registration: What Is It?
**By law**, anyone working on gas appliances MUST be Gas Safe registered.

items: Check what work they're qualified for (not all Gas Safe engineers do boilers)
Ask to see their Gas Safe ID card
Deadly dangerous (CO kills 50 people/year in UK)
Can't sell house (conveyancers ask for Gas Safe certificates)

content.text: ⚠️ 'Mate who does gas' is NOT Gas Safe registered. You risk death, prosecution, and insurance won't pay out if your house explodes.

**Know where your gas meter is:** So you can turn it off in emergency
**Check flame color:** Blue = good, yellow/orange = CO risk (call Gas Safe engineer)
**Don't ignore warning signs:** Strange smells, pilot light issues, noises
**Ventilation:** Keep air vents clear (boilers need oxygen)
**Landlords:** Legal requirement for annual Gas Safety Certificate (£60-£100)
